posts.post_content:
Anyone have a T207 McKechnie for sale or trade?  Not too concerned about condition.  And....I'll throw this out there, although fat chance....anyone have a T5 Pinkerton Cabinet of McKechnie collecting dust? ;)

Jimi
I would pay someone just to see an image of a T5 Cabinet of McKechnie!

[quote name="h2oya311" post=1714174]I would pay someone just to see an image of a T5 Cabinet of McKechnie![/QUOTE]



I don’t know if I’m THAT crazy yet...but yes, I’d like to see an image too.  Pretty sure I’m about to consider it as being not real at this point.  T207 is probably his earliest card.....until someone shows me an image of the T5! ;)

Jimi


Sent from my iPhone using Tapatalk

[quote name="jimivintage" post=1714183]I don’t know if I’m THAT crazy yet...but yes, I’d like to see an image too.  Pretty sure I’m about to consider it as being not real at this point.  T207 is probably his earliest card.....until someone shows me an image of the T5! ;)

Jimi

Sent from my iPhone using Tapatalk[/QUOTE]

It's part of the official checklist of T5 Pinkertons that one could purchase back in 1911 from early advertising of the set, but I doubt Mckechnie (of the minor leagues) was a popular choice.  There might be one (or more) floating around out there...but I have yet to see one.

[quote name="h2oya311" post=1714504]It's part of the official checklist of T5 Pinkertons that one could purchase back in 1911 from early advertising of the set, but I doubt Mckechnie (of the minor leagues) was a popular choice.  There might be one (or more) floating around out there...but I have yet to see one.[/QUOTE]



Oh I know.  I’m just flustered I’ve never seen one.  Would be out if my price range even if it did cross my path. :(
